Description: Six joining rim and neck fragments of Milesian Fikellura pottery amphora with handle root; pale slip; interior: two wide black bands below tall, slightly everted rim; reserved below; top of rim glazed; exterior: vertical bars on rim; at junction of rim and neck, wide black band above row of short vertical bars; below, black zone around handle root; at right, double or possibly triple cable pattern frieze around neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0208.54.b. H4618 written on interior of every sherd; H2779 written on interior of two sherds; brief note from J. M. Cook describing vessel and stating it was possibly made in Rhodes. J. M. Cook 1972
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.063)
